sub_title: Engineer | Civil Engineering | Environmental Sciences | Enthusiastic | Eager to Learn | Ambitious | Energetic
summary:
I am an enthusiastic, inquisitive, ambitious and energetic person. I can work independently, take initiative and set priorities. On top of that I am able to work accurately, and quickly understand the situation at hand and know how to deal with it. I work seriously and organized and I am driven by what I do. I am a good networker and I do everything to get the most out of myself (and others) in order to achieve the best result.

Working in the food service industry has taught me to work hard and continuously. I have worked in various positions within the field of (civil) engineering and during these periods I have learned allot. 

If you are searching for a person who is willing to work hard and wants to give his all, then I am the right person for you.

projects.title: Verniewing Amstelveenlijn (Renewal Amstelveen Line)
projects.description:
The 'Renewal Amstelveen Line' project is a project located in Amstelveen (The Netherlands). The Amstelveen Line or tram line 51 is a line which has been operational since 1990, practically in its current form.  It has become an important part of regional public transport. But the current trams are dated, often packed, not running often enough and prone to malfunctions. In addition, there are issues with road safety around the line.

Due to these reasons the project 'Renewal Amstelveen Line' was created by 'Vervoerregio Amsterdam'. The project consists of transforming the line to allow the use of the new low-entry trams, replacing and overhauling tracks, points, power lines and technical systems, converting three intersections to grade seperated junctions and renewing and adjusting of stops to accommodate the new trams.

projects.title: Realisatie derde kolk Prinses Beatrixsluis en verbreding Lekkanaal (Realisation of a third lock chamber for the 'Prinses Beatrixsluis' and the expansion of the 'Lekkanaal')
projects.description:
Rijkswaterstaat* wanted to improve the passage of the 'Lekkanaal' and decrease the waiting periods at the 'Prinses Beatrixsluis', a lock complex build in 1938, located in the Lekkanaal near Nieuwegein (The Netherlands). The project which was created to work on these points included i.a. the realisation of a third lock chamber, the expansion of the 'Lekkanaal' and the construction of lock approaches and additional berths in the canal.

The 'Lekkanaal' containing the 'Prinses Beatrixsluis' connects the 'Amsterdam-Rijnkanaal' with the 'Lek' and is an important waterway between the Port of Rotterdam and Amsterdam.

*Rijkswaterstaat is part of the Dutch Ministry of Infrastructure and Water Management and responsible for the design, construction, management and maintenance of the main infrastructure facilities in the Netherlands.

projects.title: Capaciteitsvergroting N279 (Capacity increase of the 'N279 Noord' - A main road located between 's-Hertogenbosch and Veghel, The Netherlands)
projects.description:
On behalf of the province of North Brabant (The Netherlands) the general partnership called 'Combinatie de Vaart', composed of 'Dura Vermeer', 'Ploegam' and 'Van den Biggelaar', realized the widening of the 'N279 Noord' which is the main road located between ’s-Hertogenbosch and Veghel (The Netherlands). The road was widened from two times one, to two times two traffic lanes which made the road safer and it  improved the traffic flow.

Existing intersections located near 'Berlicum' ('Runweg'), 'Middelrode' and 'Heeswijk-Dinther' have been converted to grade separated junctions. An additional grade separated junction has been build near 'Heeswijk-Dinther Zuid' to replace the existing junction 'Laverdonk' and another one has been build at business park 'De Brand'.

Nature has also profited from the construction works, namely by the redevelopment of the 'Dynamisch Beekdal' (dynamic river valley). Due to this redevelopment the waterway called the 'Aa' is able to meander again and more space has been created for additional nature development.

profile_positions.description: Since the end of September 2020 I am involved in the Unreal Engine project from Henk Massink. The purpose of this project is to develop a 3D/virtual world in which students are able to learn about fluid dynamics.
profile_positions.title: Developer

profile_positions.description: I started working at Van Eerd Groep in November 2017 on call. I help to carry out and assist in all of the activities related to their acquired projects within the railway sector. Most of the projects which have been acquired by Van Eerd Groep have to be executed within very tight timeframes e.g. overnight, during the weekend (starting Friday night and completed by Monday early morning) or during national holidays.
profile_positions.title: Labourer

profile_positions.description: The Climate-KIC summer school, also known as the ‘Journey’, is the world’s largest climate innovation summer school. Together with 39 intelligent and like-minded people I have been on this four-week journey. We traveled from Leoben (Austria), to Munich (Germany) and ended our journey in Budapest (Hungary). We have learned about various innovation concepts, systems thinking and sustainability practices. But most of all, we have had many reflexive, deep conversations about climate innovation and on personal level which contributed to my personal development.
profile_positions.title: Summer School Participant

profile_positions.description: In de periode van juli tot en met augustus 2018 ben ik werkzaam geweest als magazijnmedewerker en koerier bij Staadegaard TC, onderdeel van Alliance Automotive Group Benelux.
